Kingdom

Republic of Frada

Quick Facts

  5. Republic of Frada

‚ÄúFall in Line. Or Fall.‚Äù ‚Äî inscribed at every city gate in the Republic of Frada.

The Republic of Frada is the most militarized functional democracy in Criozevan: a republic where every law has a military precedent, every civic title has a military equivalent, and children dream not of a career but of which division they will serve. It is not a totalitarian state ‚Äî citizens vote, debate, and protest ‚Äî but the presumption underlying all of it is that the Republic‚Äôs strength is the Republic‚Äôs virtue, and strength is measured in steel, discipline, and holotech output.

Capital & Settlements

Frada (Capital) is built around the Glass Bastion ‚Äî a transparent dome of reinforced crystal that serves as the Senate chamber and physically reflects incoming spells and projectiles. Grid-like roads allow rapid military lockdowns. Diverse population, weak civilian government, medium crime. Doesn‚Äôt prioritize outsiders.

Hiypolis (Military City) is one of the most fortified cities in Criozevan. Houses the Fradan War College, Republic Armory, and Holo-Tech Forge Docks. Divided into training zones, living zones, and the Foundry Belt. In wartime, the entire city can transform into a mobile supply fortress via rail barge and sky towers. It sits uniquely close to the Ipadora Sanctuary ‚Äî the only non-desert city with direct connection to the Ipadora Kingdom.

Government: The Bronze Chain

The Senate (26 members): Elected by citizen-vote from each province or army division. Every senator must have served at least 5 years in the armed forces before eligibility.

The Command Council (9 generals): Active military officers elected by senior war veterans. Handles defense policy and emergency declarations.

Final decisions require both sides. Martial law gives the Command Council unilateral authority.

Military

Universal military service: every citizen serves at least 3 years.

  • Shield Corps ‚Äî Heavy infantry, holo-shield breach tactics
  • Striker Units ‚Äî Elite adaptive holo-stealth recon and assault
  • Sky Darts ‚Äî Air division: hover-tech, drop deployment, scout gliders
  • Black Cloaks ‚Äî Internal watchdogs; hunt deserters (‚ÄúBroken Links‚Äù) until eliminated
  • Forge Guard ‚Äî Tech-specialists: AI-linked armor, holo weapons, mech support

Economy & Holotech

Holo-tech weapons are Frada‚Äôs primary national export: energy blades, battlefield vision suites, custom gear for the Goldhelm Kingdom, Oredsy, and Pegasus-aligned factions. The Foundry Belt updates blueprints daily and pressure-forges combat suits.

The relationship with the Goldhelm Kingdom (exclusive trade partnership) gives both nations significant advantages: Goldhelm gets Frada‚Äôs military output; Frada gets Goldhelm‚Äôs scientific research.

Culture

Utility, loyalty, sacrifice. Art is an optional luxury for retired veterans. The March of Flame commemorates holotech‚Äôs invention annually. The Spine Track ‚Äî a long stone pathway between Frada and Hiypolis ‚Äî serves as the site for honor marches, war games, and public exile.
